abstract: Advertising column; segment on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert that featured bowl of Lucky Charms cereal and passing reference to Wheaties, both General Mills brands, points to how ingrained General Mills products are in national consciousness; company has archive in its Minnesota headquarters that houses brand memorabilia from over decades, and has made some items available to media in celebration of 150th anniversary.
lead_paragraph: For its 150th anniversary, General Mills showed off selected items in its 3,000-square-foot archive, highlighting its brands’ impact on pop culture.

headline.main: When the Lone Ranger and Gracie Allen Pitched Their Sponsors’ Products
headline.print_headline: When the Lone Ranger and Gracie Allen Pitched Sponsors’ Products

snippet: For its 150th anniversary, General Mills showed off selected items in its 3,000-square-foot archive, highlighting its brands’ impact on pop culture.
